sentences.english: We lay at anchor outside the harbour.
Our house-boat is moored to a sandbank on the farther side of the river.
sentences.chinese: 我們的遊艇停泊在靠近河對岸的一個沙洲旁。

sentences.english: They took up a berth near the harbor.
sentences.chinese: 一艘輪船在碼頭泊位停泊。

sentences.english: They then landed the liberty at John Hancock's wharf in Boston.
sentences.chinese: 隨後他們把自由號停泊在漢考克的碼頭。

sentences.english: Be aware of the risks in the countries where you berth.
sentences.chinese: 對停泊港口國家的疾病感染風險有所瞭解。

sentences.english: The ship stopped here to take in freight.
sentences.chinese: 這艘船在這裏停泊裝貨。

sentences.english: The docks can berth over fifty vessels.
sentences.chinese: 這個碼頭可以停泊五十多艘輪船。

sentences.english: The harbour was blockaded,so the ships had to lay off.
sentences.chinese: 港口被封鎖了，船隻只得在港外停泊了。

sentences.english: Cruise ships visit Ny Alesund throughout the summer, some small, some large.
sentences.chinese: 夏季會有遊艇停泊在新奧勒松，有小的，也有大的。

sentences.english: He was becalmed for a whole week north of the island.
sentences.chinese: 他在海島北面因無風而停泊了整整一週。

sentences.english: The organiser encourages all participants to park your vehicle at the Science Park carpark.
sentences.chinese: 大會鼓勵各參賽者將車輛停泊在科學園停車場。

sentences.english: The cruiser stood off the beaches, waiting for the orders.
sentences.chinese: 巡洋艦停泊在遠離海灘的地方待命。

sentences.english: The ship was anchored athwart the harbour mouth.
You must stay clear of fairway.
sentences.chinese: 你船必須遠離航道停泊。

sentences.english: A jetty pier, some two thousand yards along, extended into the roadstead .
sentences.chinese: 一座長達兩千碼的凸式碼頭一直延伸到船的停泊處。

sentences.english: It is not safe for the ships to ride (at anchor) in the harbour when the enemy planes are hovering overhead.
sentences.chinese: 當敵機在上空盤旋時，船隻停泊在港內是不安全的。

definition: (of a boat) to reach the shore/to pull toward shore/close to shore/landfall
